title: Type on fire truck - Aachen, Helvetica, ??? {Eric Hague}
content:
Hey Everyone,

Long time reader, first time poster. So I’m trying to figure out what several fonts are to try and match them. Any ideas?

I went through all the fonts on my computer but couldn’t come up with a match for the numbers.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/204_6236.jpg)

Also I need to match these fonts if you know them

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/engine1_6332.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/engine2_3933.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/engine3_6511.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540im_/http:/typophile.com/files/engine4_5119.jpg)

I really appreciate any feedback!

Thanks,

Jason

 [‹ Font ID: Art Fairs Inc. logo contemporary squarish sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540/http:/typophile.com/node/43551 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Light sans caps w/ alternates - Fedra Display {Conor} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211540/http:/typophile.com/node/43498 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Capitan

comments.content: Top is Aachen, bottom two are Helvetica and Helvetica Italic.
No problem. Others can follow up with more specific answers. I’ve been really rusty at this lately.
Not too rusty! I thought those numbers would be a hard one.

Anyone have any ideas on the “engine 2-2” or “chinchilla hose co” font?

Thanks!
